FacilityName: Doe and Ingalls of Virginia Operating, LLC.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
M to 5PM.  Emergency off-site personnel are available 24-hours. 
Doe and Ingalls, LLC Virginia facility consist of one large storage facility subdivided into five areas providing separate storage by hazard class that have identical prevention practices for the entire warehouse. All operations are considered as one single process.   As a warehouse, Doe and Ingalls of VA, LLC does not have single storage tanks of regulated substances above the threshold quantity; however the facility does store collective amounts of such materials in 55-gallon or less containers in the same general locations.  
Doe and Ingalls, LLC stores, handles and distributes 30% or less of Ammonium Hydroxide (NH4OH) and 38% or less of Hydrochloric Acid or Hydrogen Chloride (HCL) in 55-gallon drums and four liter bottles.  The quantity in pounds of these two regulated substances exceeds their respective threshold planning quantity subjecting the facility to the RMP rule.  Based on the Worst Case Scenario and the Off Site Consequence Analysis, Doe and Ingalls, LLC Virginia facility is eligible for Program 2.
Doe and Ingalls of VA, LLC has not experienced a release of a regulated substance in the past five years.  In general, if a spill of regulated substance or any other material (hazardous or non-hazardous) consisting of less than 55-gallons; spill kits are deployed to contain the spill and the compromised container is placed in an overpack container for disposal.  Spill Response Team Leaders (EC) participates in bi-annual HAZWOPER training and all Hazmat employees receive initial and reoccurring hazardous material training.  The facility maintains relationships with local emergency response and environmental firms to provide additional assistance as necessary.  In addition, the facility was engineered with strict adherence to Model Building and Fire Codes including the National Fire Protection Agency for chemical storage including temperature control, containment systems, liquid tight floors, sop

histicated fire protection systems and emergency power.
-    The facility maintains Emergency Preparedness Contingency Plans (EPCP) on site. 
Doe and Ingalls, LLC is an ISO 9001:2000 (International Organization for Standardization) certified company that maintains detailed operating policies/procedures and is dedicated to continuous improvement including enhancements to facility safety.
